utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Could you start by telling me what brought you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So like I don't really feel sick. I just I lost. I can't. I for the past two days I can't smell anything. I can't taste any of my food. It's super weird I like live with my boyfriend and he was like here take a bite of this onion and I like bit into it and I literally didn't taste anything. Otherwise, like I feel totally fine. I just heard that this happens sometimes like with COVID and. I'm just kind of worried that I have COVID.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, for sure I will we will, um definitely look into that today and you are right, it is a symptom that can occur with with covid. But we will want to make sure that it isn't something else, and so I wanted to just ask you a few more questions about how you've been feeling. So you said you haven't felt sick, so have you been experiencing any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I mean, I may be even a bit tired, but really. Otherwise no. I guess maybe I felt like a little dry, but I haven't actually been coughing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So no cough have you felt a like short of breath at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you brought up any like, sputum or any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any feeling like your heart is ready racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, um, any nausea or vomiting.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any diarrhea or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes to urinary habits. Any painful urination or needing to go more often?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and have you had any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mmm no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh, how about any fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't, like I don't have a thermometer, I like maybe felt a little hot, but like like I don't really know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, or how about any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And recently, over the last several months, have you had any changes to your weight?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And in the last several days, have you had a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like I said, it felt like dry, but I don't think it's been sore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um. And have you had a runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Or felt congested at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then any eye pain or ear pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then any rashes on your skin?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like I have eczema, but nothing new.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and in regards to your past health do you have any medical conditions that you're followed for,

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like the eczema, like I have like a peanut allergy. That's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK, do you have an EpiPen?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you keep that with you regularly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, always.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, excellent um, and do you take any other medications or?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I take birth control. An like sometimes like I had, I had like eczema cream like the the steroid one for when it's really bad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when did you start birth control?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe like three years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how often are you using the cream?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's kind of like goes in like flares, so like this, 'cause it's winter I've been using it like maybe a couple times a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and. Any allergies to medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you had any surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any reason reason for hospitalization?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sorry I went to the Emergency Department like when I had my peanut like the first time I realized I was allergic to peanuts. But that was it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, did you have an anaphylactic reaction?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, like I was a kid. So. I don't really remember that much, but that's when they told me I was allergic.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK, so important to have the EpiPen then for sure.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And so you mentioned that you're living with your boyfriend?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, anybody else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, just us.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and as your boyfriend been sick at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And at like have you been around anybody who's been sick at work or school?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no like all my classes are online, so I don't really see anyone besides him right now like we don't even officially like together. He's just been essentially staying at my apartment, 'cause like we don't see anyone else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, and do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you smoke marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like occasionally we will like. Do an edible or something, but I don't smoke it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any other recreational drugs like cocaine, MDMA?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and uh are you currently sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, just like with my boyfriend.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and um. Any sexually transmitted infections in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um. And then do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like maybe a couple of beers on the weekend.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and in your family, has anybody ever lost their smell before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, anybody in the family have a heart condition or a lung condition?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright and then I have anybody in the family had cancer before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like my like my Uncle um had like prostate cancer.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you know, breast cancer, ovarian cancer?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So that that was all I wanted to ask about on, uh, the history today. Was there anything else that I maybe forgot to ask about?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mmm I don't know that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so, uh, yeah with, uh, the symptoms of losing your smell over the last day or so we will certainly look into. Whether or not this is caused by COVID and so that will require a nasal swab test for that. Usually the results are coming back now within 48 hours hopefully, but still will be required to self isolate now for the next 14 days after your symptoms are gone, so we will let you know when the results come back from this test though.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK. OK, geez OK. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
